title: Aces' Wilson crowned as WNBA's first 4-time MVP
content: A'ja Wilson has become the WNBA's first four-time MVP after earning the league's top individual honor for the second straight year.

title: SEC calls out refs for missing OU's 'hideout tactic'
content: The SEC vowed "appropriate accountability" after it said officials failed to identify a "hideout tactic" on Oklahoma's second-quarter touchdown against Auburn.

title: Parcells on Pats exit: Wish I did things differently
content: Bill Parcells said the Patriots franchise will always have a place in his heart before referencing his acrimonious departure in 1997, admitting he wished he "would have done things a little differently."

title: Manning gets 'swagger back' as Longhorns roll
content: Arch Manning passed for 309 yards and three touchdowns in his sharpest game of the season as No. 8 Texas cruised to a 55-0 win over Sam Houston.

title: Richardson, Lyles help U.S. sweep relay golds
content: Sha'Carri Richardson and Noah Lyles blasted through the anchor legs of back-to-back wins in the rainy 4x100s to close out the world championships with a relay sweep for the U.S.

title: Dabo wears pain on sleeve as Tigers drop to 1-3
content: Dabo Swinney wore his pain on his sleeve after Saturday's 34-21 home loss to Syracuse dropped Clemson to 1-3, his worst start as the Tigers' head coach.

title: Indiana hangs 63 on No. 9 Illini in statement win
content: Indiana broke the Big Ten record for points against an AP top-10 opponent after dropping 63 in a blowout victory over No. 9 Illinois.

title: Paolini seals win as Italy retains BJK Cup vs. U.S.
content: Jasmine Paolini beat Jessica Pegula on the fourth match point as defending champion Italy won the Billie Jean King Cup with a comprehensive victory over the United States.

title: üèà Viral 'Capt. Andrew Luck' account is back
content: Andrew Luck made his return to football in late 2024 in a surprising role, as Stanford football GM. As Luck returned, so did an old social media legend: Capt. Andrew Luck.

title: Week 3 inactives: Who's in and who's out?
content: Updated inactives and analysis based on the latest reports and official announcements leading up to kickoff.

title: Last-minute prep for NFL Week 3: Stat trends, fantasy sleepers, upsets picks and more
content: Big week on deck for Romeo Doubs? Matchup advantages for Hollywood Brown? And the Eagles on upset watch? Catch up on Week 3 prep.

title: Wrestlepalooza takeaways: Lesnar demolishes WWE legend in brutal beatdown
content: John Cena lost, AJ Lee returned and The Vision took care of The Usos. What does their future look like after Wrestlepalooza?

title: Will Raleigh finish strong? Can Astros score without Alvarez? 5 things that will decide the AL West race
content: The Mariners and Astros are about to face off with the division title and playoff seeding on the line. Here's what will determine the race.

title: üèÄ Inside Kawhi Leonard's tumultuous time in L.A.
content: Just weeks after the Clippers shocked the NBA world by signing the 2019 NBA MVP, a feeling percolated across the organization: fear.

title: üîü Barnwell ranks every winless NFL team
content: Can the Chiefs or Texans turn it around? Do the Bears have a chance in the NFC? Is the season already over for the Giants and Jets?

title: üí∞ Could a salary cap really come to baseball?
content: There are two words MLB and the MLBPA simply cannot agree on. Here's how it got this way and what it means for the next CBA.

title: üèà Why doesn't NFL every team use tush push?
content: The Eagles have converted the tush push 96.6% of the time on fourth-and-1, so why don't all teams use it? Here's why.

title: ‚öæ Dodgers' Clayton Kershaw to retire after season
content: Clayton Kershaw, a three-time National League Cy Young Award winner and 11-time All-Star with the Dodgers, will retire after this season. "I'm at peace with it," he said. "I think it's the right time."

title: üé§ Johnson: Not giving 'trade secrets' to Brady
content: Ben Johnson isn't worried about divulging information that can be used against the Bears when he participates in production meetings with Tom Brady.

title: Doncic's summer transformation signals Lakers' new era
content: After a historic summer on the court and massive changes off it, Luka Doncic has sent a message to the NBA. And his new team responded in kind.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Bar√ßa eye Haaland as Lewandowski replacement
content: Barcelona have identified Manchester City striker Erling Haaland as their dream replacement for Robert Lewandowski. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: Fantasy basketball: Sleepers, breakouts and busts for 2025-26
content: Which fantasy basketball players are going to exceed expectations in 2025-26? Who will disappoint? Who is ready to take things to an elite level? Our experts list their picks.

title: Buy the dip: Thirteen players primed for bounce-back seasons
content: These fantasy hockey players underwhelmed last season, but could return to better production this year.

title: 'Hope for peace': UK, Canada, Australia recognise Palestinian state
content: In a historic move, UK Prime Minister Keir Starmer announced Britain's formal recognition of a Palestinian state, aiming to revive peace prospects. Despite opposition from the US and Israel, Starmer defends the decision as crucial for ending the Gaza conflict and fostering lasting peace. Deputy PM David Lammy emphasized it keeps the two-state solution alive, correcting a historical injustice.

title: PM Modi: Income tax & GST cuts to save Rs 2.5L cr; take pride in buying ‚Äòswadeshi‚Äô
content: Prime Minister Modi spoke of upcoming GST reforms, effective September 22, 2025, calling it 'GST Bachat Utsav'. The revised tax structure features only 5% and 18% slabs, reducing prices on everyday items. Income up to ‚Çπ12 lakh is now tax-exempt, creating a 'double bonanza' for the middle class.

title: 'Not an MLA, but get Rs 20 cr in funds': Sena leader Sarvankar boasts; later clarifies
content: Sada Sarvankar, ex-Shiv Sena MLA, sparked controversy by asserting he secures more funds for his constituency than the current MLA. He stated he brings in ‚Çπ20 crore, contrasting it with Mahesh Sawant's complaints of insufficient resources. Sarvankar, a key figure in the 2022 rebellion siding with Eknath Shinde, clarified he was referring to funds managed for the Dadar-Mahim area.

title: H-1B visa crisis: Goldman Sachs issues guidance
content: Goldman Sachs is advising its H1-B visa workers to consult with immigration law firm Fragomen amidst new regulations. This follows President Trump's announcement of a potential $100,000 annual fee for each H1-B visa holder. Major companies like JPMorgan, Amazon, Google, and Microsoft are urging their H1-B and H-4 visa employees to return to the U.S.

title: PM Modi's address: NDA hails 'GST Bachat Utsav'; oppn calls it a 'band-aid' fix
content: Following PM Modi's announcement of next-generation GST reforms, opposition leaders criticized the changes as inadequate and overdue, while BJP leaders praised the Prime Minister's initiative. Congress leaders demanded an apology for past GST implementations, while AAP focused on international trade issues.

title: IND vs PAK: Handshake drama continues! SKY humiliates Salman again
content: The India-Pakistan Asia Cup clash is again under scrutiny after Suryakumar Yadav seemingly snubbed Salman Agha at the toss, reigniting handshake controversy from their previous encounter. Avoiding direct comment on the issue during a press conference, Suryakumar emphasized the team's focus on their performance and preparation, despite facing criticism from fans advocating a boycott following the Pahalgam attack.

title: GST reforms will accelerate India's growth story, says PM Modi - top quotes
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi addressed the nation on Sunday, celebrating the upcoming implementation of new GST reforms on September 22. He hailed the initiative as "GST Bachat Utsav," emphasizing its significance in advancing Aatmanirbhar Bharat. Modi highlighted the timing of the reforms with the start of Navratri, framing it as a crucial step towards self-reliant India.

title: H-1B visa hike: Zoho founder to Indians in US; ‚ÄòDo not live in fear‚Äô
content: Following the significant H-1B visa fee increase announced by the US, Zoho founder Sridhar Vembu is encouraging Indian tech professionals in America to return to India. Drawing parallels with the Partition, Vembu assures them that rebuilding their lives in India will ultimately lead to success, given the country's burgeoning opportunities and thriving tech ecosystem.

title: Encounter breaks out between Army & terrorists in J&K; operation under way
content: On Sunday, the Army engaged in a firefight with terrorists in a forest area of Kishtwar district, Jammu and Kashmir, during an intelligence-based operation. The exchange of fire occurred around 1 pm, but there were no immediate reports of casualties. This incident follows a recent encounter near the Doda-Udhampur border on Friday, where one soldier was injured.

title: Asia Cup: India unleash their strongest missile vs Pakistan - Who is back in XI?
content: India and Pakistan are poised for a high-stakes Asia Cup Super Four showdown in Dubai. Jasprit Bumrah's return bolsters India's lineup, while Pakistan grapples with batting consistency. Off-field drama adds to the tension, with Pakistan's cancelled press conference highlighting the uncertainty. While India appear stronger on paper, Pakistan's unpredictability makes them a formidable opponent.

title: Youth ODIs: Not 14-yo Suryavanshi! Two India U19 batters shine in win vs Oz
content: India U19 triumphed over Australia U19 by seven wickets in the first Youth ODI, powered by impressive unbeaten half-centuries from Abhigyan Kundu (87) and Vedant Trivedi (61). Their 152-run partnership guided India to chase down the target of 226 with ease, despite early wickets. Henil Patel's 3-38 restricted Australia to 225/9, with John James's unbeaten 77 providing some resistance.

title: H-1B visa hike: JPMorgan asks staff to return to US before Sept 21
content: JPMorgan and Microsoft are urging H-1B visa holders to return to the U.S. immediately due to President Trump's new directive imposing a $100,000 annual fee on companies for each H-1B worker. This move, effective September 21st, is anticipated to disproportionately impact Indian IT firms like Infosys and TCS, who heavily rely on H-1B visas to deploy professionals in the U.S.

title: $100k H-1B fees higher than salaries of many professionals: L-1 visas an alternative?
content: The Trump administration's $100,000 H-1B visa fee hike is poised to significantly impact the Indian IT sector. Companies may explore L-1 visas, but these face limitations and increased scrutiny. Experts warn of workforce departures, offshore job movement, and a potential boost for countries like India.

title: Asia Cup: Shocking! PSL franchise omits India again from matchday poster again
content: The India versus Pakistan Asia Cup match faces controversy. Karachi Kings' poster excludes India, sparking outrage. Earlier, India won against Pakistan, but handshakes were declined. A plea to cancel the match reached the Supreme Court due to terrorism concerns. Despite issues, anticipation for the cricket match remains high. Fans await the high-voltage clash.

title: Akshay Kumar jokes about Kapil's Canada Cafe firing; says 'Itni aamdani Hai ke wahan goliyan chali'
content: Akshay Kumar graced the finale of 'The Great Indian Kapil Show,' engaging in humorous banter with Kapil Sharma. Kapil playfully questioned Akshay's prolific career, leading Akshay to retort with a joke about Kapil's multiple ventures and recent issues at his Canadian caf√©. Akshay also honored stuntmen and shared life revelations during the episode.

title: Taylor Swift MetLife visit? Travis Kelce support talk; Chiefs vs Giants
content: All eyes are on MetLife Stadium this Sunday as the Kansas City Chiefs face the New York Giants. The big question: Will Taylor Swift attend to support Travis Kelce? While there's no official confirmation, sources suggest her presence is possible. Swift's appearances at Kelce's games have drawn massive attention, recalling her visit to MetLife in 2023.

title: 'Shah Rukh Khan comes by‚Ä¶': Priyadarshan on wrapping films with Govinda, Salman; calls it feat
content: Director Priyadarshan reflects on his career. He shares experiences working with actors like Salman Khan, Govinda and Shah Rukh Khan. He values the trust he shares with Akshay Kumar and Mohanlal. Priyadarshan is set to reunite with Akshay Kumar after 16 years. They will be working on 'Bhooth Bangla', 'Haiwaan', and 'Hera Pheri 3'.

title: IND vs PAK drama! Pakistan cancel press conference; Mohsin Naqvi's three-word reply sparks buzz
content: Amidst handshake controversy and tensions with the ICC match referee, PCB Chairman Mohsin Naqvi visited Pakistan's training session before their Asia Cup Super Fours clash against India. Naqvi engaged in an intense discussion with coach Mike Hesson, following the cancellation of Pakistan's pre-match press conference. The visit occurs after Pakistan sought the removal of Andy Pycroft over a handshake dispute.

title: Aaron Rodgers vs Patriots: Kenny Pickett injury update; game status today
content: Aaron Rodgers will play against the New England Patriots. He aims to achieve a career milestone. Rodgers has never won at Gillette Stadium. The Steelers will visit the Patriots in Week 3. Rodgers sees this game as a chance to strengthen his legacy. The Patriots' defense has vulnerabilities. This creates an opportunity for the Steelers' offense.

title: Rift widens in Lalu family as Rohini unfollows RJD, kin
content: The internal conflict within Lalu Prasad's family has intensified with Rohini Acharya unfollowing key family members and the RJD on social media due to disagreements over Tejashwi Yadav's associate, Sanjay Yadav. Tej Pratap Yadav has defended Rohini, escalating the family feud

title: Agassi and Graf‚Äôs son Jaden shares unseen photos with Catherine Holt as couple celebrates love
content: Jaden Agassi and Catherine Holt celebrated their three-year anniversary on September 20, 2025, sharing heartfelt messages and photos on Instagram. The couple, who adopted a French bulldog named Rocky in June, also attended the US Open women‚Äôs singles final.

title: Gracie Hunt‚Äôs Update: From heartfelt message to romance with Green; Chiefs heiress stays strong
content: Gracie Hunt, the Kansas City Chiefs' heiress, shared heartwarming photos on Instagram from a wedding she attended with her boyfriend, Derek Green. The couple, who have known each other since childhood through their families' connection to the Chiefs, looked deeply in love. Hunt expressed her views on love and faith in the post's caption, emphasizing its importance in daily life.

title: ‚ÄòZero civic sense‚Äô: Tourists 'vandalise' Humayun‚Äôs Tomb in Delhi
content: A video showing visitors allegedly vandalising Humayun's Tomb, a UNESCO World Heritage Site, has sparked outrage online. The footage shows a young man scribbling on a wall while others film. While some shots appear to be from other locations, ASI officials confirmed parts of the video were from the tomb.

title: Asia Cup: Rajeev Shukla predicts outcome for IND vs PAK Super 4 clash
content: India and Pakistan are set for a Super Four clash in the Asia Cup 2025, following India's earlier victory. The previous match was marred by controversy, including a 'no handshake' incident and PCB complaints against an ICC official. These off-field tensions, along with recent events, could significantly influence both teams' strategies and performance in the upcoming high-stakes encounter.

title: Hitman is back! Rohit Sharma trains with KL Rahul, shows fierce hitting ahead of Australia ODIs
content: Rohit Sharma and KL Rahul are honing their skills at the BCCI's Centre of Excellence in Bengaluru, marking their first joint session since the Border-Gavaskar Trophy. Rahul is gearing up for a multi-day game against Australia A, while Sharma prepares to lead India in the upcoming ODI series in Australia.

title: From Covid to Op Sindoor: PM Modi's speeches over the years; all eyes on 5pm address
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi is set to address the nation at 5 pm on Sunday, as confirmed by the PMO. While the topic remains undisclosed, speculations suggest a focus on economic changes, coinciding with Navratri's start and upcoming GST reforms. Over his more than ten years in office, PM Modi has often addressed the nation to announce major decisions.

title: 'Will he address concerns or same talk again': Congress on PM Modi speech
content: Jairam Ramesh criticizes PM Modi, alleging that Donald Trump, Modi's "good friend," repeatedly claimed credit for halting Operation Sindoor by leveraging trade with America. Ramesh questions whether Modi will address deteriorating India-US relations, H1B holder concerns, or tariff-related livelihood risks during his address to the nation.

title: Zubeen Garg‚Äôs final journey: Thousands bid farewell to Assam‚Äôs music icon
content: Assam mourns the loss of Zubeen Garg, its beloved singer, whose remains arrived in Guwahati on Sunday. Tens of thousands of fans lined the streets, paying their respects to the artist, who died in Singapore following a swimming accident. The outpouring of grief saw shops closed and citizens gathering to honor Garg, a cultural icon who recorded over 38,000 songs.

title: Bengaluru residents protest, demand pothole-free roads
content: Residents of Varthur and Gunjur are protesting for better roads. A recent death due to traffic has sparked outrage. People are demanding pothole-free and dust-free roads. The Karnataka Road Development Corporation Limited road widening project is delayed. Alternative routes are also in poor condition. Residents are frustrated with daily struggles and demand immediate action. Police intervened in protests outside residences.

title: 'Our cricket is in a pathetic state'- Former Pak player drops bombshell ahead of India clash
content: Following Pakistan's dismal performance against India in the Asia Cup, Danish Kaneria has strongly criticized the national team and its management. He highlighted the lack of accountability and strategic planning within Pakistan cricket. The controversy surrounding the handshake snub and calls for structural changes underscore the urgent need for improvement as they face India again in the Super 4s.

title: 4-year-old kidnapped, thrown off cliff by teen neighbor seeking revenge on boy‚Äôs mother
content: In a shocking incident in Delhi's Anand Parbat, a four-year-old boy is critically injured after being kidnapped and attacked by a 15-year-old neighbor. The teenager, seeking revenge against the boy's mother for a previous disciplinary action, lured the child to a secluded area, threw him off a cliff, and bludgeoned him with a rock.

title: Blindfolded cow pushed into drain; rescued by villagers in Haryana
content: In a disturbing incident near Jamal village, Sirsa, villagers discovered a cow blindfolded and struggling in a drain. Residents rescued the animal, which had been deliberately thrown into the water overnight. The cow is now under the care of the Maharishi Dayanand Saraswati Gaushala Committee, while villagers condemn the inhumane act and demand strict action against those responsible.

title: No mercy! Suryavanshi targets Australia bowlers - Watch
content: Vaibhav Suryavanshi, the 14-year-old phenomenon, ignited India's chase of 225 against Australia U19 with a rapid 38 off 22 balls, including seven fours and a six. His aggressive start put the Australian bowlers under pressure early on. Despite a shaky start for the middle order after his dismissal, Suryavanshi's power-hitting became the highlight of India's innings.

title: IND vs PAK showdown: Declaration - 'India will beat Pakistan in Super Four'
content: Monty Panesar believes the India-Pakistan handshake controversy has dampened enthusiasm for their Asia Cup Super 4 match. He urges both teams to prioritize cricket amid political tensions. Panesar predicts India will win the upcoming game. The reduced excitement reflects strained relations between the two nations. India previously defeated Pakistan by seven wickets.

title: 'Shahid Afridi dog meat khaata hai': Irfan Pathan‚Äôs brutal attack on Afridi
content: Irfan Pathan revealed a heated exchange with Shahid Afridi during a 2006 flight from Karachi to Lahore, where Afridi's condescending behavior sparked a verbal altercation. Pathan recounted how he cleverly silenced Afridi by humorously suggesting he had consumed dog meat after Afridi used abusive language.

title: Birthday bash turns tragic in Gujarat: 25-year-old stabbed to death by robber
content: In a tragic turn, Vaibhav Manwani's 25th birthday celebration ended in his fatal stabbing near Ahmedabad's Narmada canal. A robber attacked Manwani and his 23-year-old friend, who bravely ran 800 meters for help despite her own stab wounds. She is now stable in Civil Hospital.

title: Trump repeats 'Putin let me down'; pushes for pause on oil drilling
content: Donald Trump has once again criticized Vladimir Putin regarding the war in Ukraine, stating the Russian leader "let me down." Trump suggested that increasing oil production could lower prices and potentially halt the conflict. He also claimed the war wouldn't have occurred if he were still president, asserting Putin didn't respect President Biden's leadership, leading to the invasion.

title: Lucknow mall: Bouncer shot, many injured after party continued past closing time
content: A late-night dispute at a Lucknow mall's club escalated into violence when a group, including a doctor, clashed with bouncers after refusing to end their party. One of the men allegedly shot a bouncer, injuring him and a colleague. Enraged bouncers retaliated, assaulting the group. Police arrested four individuals and recovered a licensed pistol and ammunition.

title: Govt. medical college teachers in State to observe ‚Äòblack day‚Äô on September 22
content: They are demanding creation of new posts in the newly set up medical colleges as well as solution to wage-related issues

title: After uproar, backward classes commission decides to mask 33 Christian sub-castes from list for survey
content: After an uproar in political circles over the ‚Äúinclusion of new castes‚Äù in the Christian sub-caste category, the Karnataka State Commission for Backward Classes will mask 33 Christian sub-castes in the mobile application provided to enumerators for the socio-educational survey

title: Tamil Nadu among States that account for a majority share of discoms‚Äô regulatory assets
content: The regulatory assets position at the all-India level remains elevated at¬†‚Çπ3 lakh crore, mainly driven by Tamil Nadu, Uttar Pradesh, Rajasthan, Maharashtra, Delhi, West Bengal and Karnataka, says ICRA

title: T.N. govt. cannot put its political priority above the interests of students, Dharmendra Pradhan says of funds under Samagra Shiksha
content: The Union Minister insists that the Tamil Nadu government  accept the memorandum of understanding offered by the Centre for disbursal of Samagra Shiksha funds. The MoU mandates introduction of the three-language formula

title: Use power to empower others, AICC secretary urges youth
content: About 150 professionals from Palakkad, Chittur, Nenmara, Malampuzha and Kongad take part in leadership training camp for youth organised by All India Professional Congress

title: Eknath Shinde‚Äôs X account hacked; Congress raises alarm over cyber security
content: Hackers posted Pakistan, Turkey flags; account control regained within 30-45 minutes as Nana Patole demands Home Dept answers

title: Second socio-educational survey set to commence on September 22 across Karnataka, barring Greater Bengaluru Authority area
content: Barring the Greater Bengaluru Authority (GBA) area, the second socio-educational survey being conducted by the Karnataka State Commission for Backward Classes to enumerate a population of seven crore will commence across Karnataka

title: Ayurvedic medicine manufacturers in Kerala exploring legal options to get ‚Äòbhasmam‚Äô from Forest dept.
content: A 2023 amendment to the Wildlife (Protection) Act, 1972, permits incineration of dead animals‚Äô horns and tusks, the ash of which is a major component of Ayurvedic medicines. Though the drug manufacturers are keen on getting the ash released, Forest dept. officials say it may not be legally possible

title: GST 2.0 will increase people‚Äôs purchasing power, says Andhra Pradesh Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu¬†
content: The slashing of GST on many essential goods is a big¬† positive for the middle classes, farmers and artisans, he says

title: Yaduveer questions move to conduct caste census ‚Äòhastily‚Äô
content: ‚ÄòThe caste census scheduled to begin from September 22 coincides with Dasara festivities when people are busy travelling and officials tied up with festival duties‚Äô

title: SIT investigation will reveal truth behind ‚Äòfraud‚Äô in electoral revision, says MLC
content: The State government will initiate action against those found guilty by the SIT, according to Saleem Ahmed

title: State govt. issues order permitting Kerala Water Authority to take ‚Çπ9,000-crore NABARD loan for Jal Jeevan Mission
content: In the first phase, the KWA will secure a loan of ‚Çπ5,000 crore for the completion of the scheme that envisions 100% tap connectivity in rural households

title: Kurmi Adivasi Samaj to resume protests in Purulia on September 25
content: Community leaders renew demand for Scheduled Tribe status despite police crackdown and High Court order

title: PM Modi claiming ‚Äòsole ownership‚Äô of GST regime amendments: Congress leader Jairam Ramesh
content: Jairam Ramesh said the current GST reforms were inadequate, with outstanding issues, including the widespread concerns of MSMEs, the major employment generators in the economy

title: Countdown for Dasara inauguration¬†
content: Kannada writer Banu Mushtaq will inaugurate the festival at Chamundeshwari Temple between 10.10 a.m. and 10.40 a.m. in the presence of Chief Minister Siddaramaiah and other leaders.

title: Identify yourselves as Hindus or lose quota benefits, Yatnal tells Lingayats
content: Some Lingayat communities are in category 2A because they are considered one of the many Hindu castes, says Hindutva leader

title: IT Minister Lokesh promises to address irritants faced by Rural Development Trust
content: RDT Anantapur Programme Director Moncho Ferrer calls on Lokesh and explains the problems being faced, especially licence-related issues

title: Karnataka govt. releases draft to set up Fare Regulatory Committee for public transport
content: At present, Karnataka‚Äôs four road transport corporations-KSRTC, BMTC, NWKRTC and NEKRTC are required to submit individual proposals to the State Government whenever a fare revision is sought.

title: Slew of events lined up for Dasara festival in Mysuru
content: The main cultural event at the palace will be inaugurated on Monday and Chief Minister Siddaramaiah will bestow Rajya Sangeetha¬†Vidwan Award to Hindustani vocalist M. Venkatesh Kumar at a function

title: Former TTD Chairman Bhumana Karunakar Reddy behind ‚ÄòParakamani scam‚Äô, alleges BJP
content: The TTD board, under YSRCP regime, erred in making a resolution to accept the tainted property from the accused and, in turn, providing him a safe exit from the legal wrangles, he asserts

title: GST 2.0 implementation a ‚Äòfestival of savings‚Äô, first step towards economic self-reliance, PM says in address to nation
content: The PM drew connections between the simplification of the GST regime and the reduction in prices resulting from it to a larger point about the need for Indians to weed out foreign-made products, boosting the country‚Äôs MSME sector

title: Encounter breaks out between Army, terrorists in J&K‚Äôs Kishtwar
content: Reinforcements have been rushed and a search operation is underway to track down and neutralize the terrorists

title: Soaps, powder, coffee, diapers, biscuits, ghee, oil to be cheaper as cos extend GST 2.0 benefits
content: The move is expected to lead to a spike in consumption and a surge in sales during the upcoming festival season, which starts with the Navratra celebrations.

title: Archbishop appeals for reunion of Kerala Congress factions to prevent vote fragmentation
content: Changanassery Archbishop‚Äôs proposal made at the release of a biography on Kerala Congress chairperson P.J. Joseph.

title: Set up counselling rooms in educational institutions to protect mental health of students, Mandya DC
content: He has suggested that every school in the district should not only set up a counselling room, but also ensure that at least one teacher undergoes special training from mental health experts on stress management to provide counselling to the students

title: KTU Syndicate members oppose Governor‚Äôs order to pay legal fees in V-C appointment case
content: They stress that the V-C cannot authorise such payments unilaterally, as all financial decisions are within the exclusive purview of the Syndicate.

title: Mysuru Dasara, a tradition steeped in history¬†
content: Though a Pan-Indian festival, Dasara in Mysuru is a spectacle blending religious practices with folk and classical performances that bring to the fore the cultural diversity of Karnataka, and is hence known as Naada Habba or the State Festival

title: BJP to launch ‚ÄòGST savings festival‚Äô with rollout of two-rate regime
content: Week-long campaign from September 22 to highlight GST reforms among traders, shopkeepers and consumers

title: TDP alleges CMO‚Äôs role in Parakamani scam
content: The leaders  wondered how the TTD chairman could unilaterally arrive at a compromise formula to save an accused from the purview of law and provide an escape route from punishment

title: Why a divided Opposition may give an edge to DMK
content: Even though Mr Dhinakaran claimed his party tilted the scales in 29 constituencies, a study by this correspondent reveals there were 20 seats wherein the votes polled by the AMMK and its allies were higher than the difference between the winner (DMK and allies) and the runner-up (AIADMK, Pattali Makkal Katchi [PMK] and the Bharatiya Janata Party [BJP])

title: Bhumana sticks to his stand on Parakamani case, demands CBI probe
content: The accused has admitted to have been stealing currency notes over the last 20 years, which also concurs with the period of TDP rule under Chief Minister Nara Chandrababu Naidu, Bhumana pointed out

title: Road rage triggers dangerous trend in Kozhikode district
content: Action sought on the part of the police and other enforcement agencies to address the safety concerns of passengers and motorists.

title: No notice from MIB to Hindi channels on use of Urdu in broadcasts: PIB
content: In a post on X, the PIB Fact Check Unit said that the Ministry of Information and Broadcasting (MIB) has forwarded a viewer's complaint to the channels.

title: Shivamogga zoo to get new animals from Indore, Aurangabad zoos
content: In return, Shivamogga zoo will be sending two Asiatic lions, sloth bears, and golden jackals each to the Aurangabad zoo on Sept. 25

title: BJP never interferes in any political party‚Äôs internal matters, says Nainar Nagenthran
content: Along with BJP national in-charge for TN Arvind Menon, Nainar Nagenthran also met AIADMK general secretary and former CM Edappadi K. Palaniswami at his residence at Nedunchalai Nagar in Salem

title: Peace prerequisite for tourism, sports sectors to flourish in J&K: Omar Abdullah
content: Lieutenant Governor Manoj Sinha had on September 20, 2025 said peace was the prerequisite for development in Jammu and Kashmir

title: BJP president urges government to reconsider RRR alignment
content: N. Ramchander Rao assured farmers of Puttapaka of Choutuppal mandal of Yadadri Bhuvanagiri district village that he will bring to the notice of the state government about their problems, who were affected due to change of alignment for RRR

title: GST reforms to accelerate growth, says PM Modi | Live
content: Calling it a ‚ÄòGST saving festival‚Äô, PM Modi said the new GST reforms that take effect on September 22 will ‚Äòbring happiness to every family‚Äô

title: Centre not imposing any language on any State: Dharmendra Pradhan
content: Dharmendra Pradhan termed those who claim that Centre imposes the three language policy on States as "politically motivated".

title: Army must rebuild ties with Gujjar, Bakerwal tribes to prevent intelligence gap on ground, say experts
content: Officials and experts feel there is growing mistrust between the security forces and the two communities that could pose a threat to intelligence gathering, which is vital for border security

title: Get ready for SIR rollout by September 30: Election Commission tells State poll officers
content: Chief Electoral Officers (CEOs) have been told to keep voter lists of their States, published after the last SIR, ready

title: Prakasam District SP‚Äôs initiative to curb menace of consumption of liquor in public places
content: The officials expect the initiative to not only bring positive change in the behaviour of the drunken persons but also in the environments in which they consume alcohol

content: The Prime Minister‚Äôs Office (PMO) gave no indication of the subject of PM Modi‚Äôs address at 5 p.m. on Sunday (September 21)

title: Patrons seek extension of Madgaon-Mangaluru MEMU Express to Subrahmanya Road
content: The extension enables optimum utilisation of the idling rake besides connecting Subrahmanya with a host of pilgrim centres along Karnataka coast

title: Protest in Belur over desecration of Ganesha idol
content: Belur MLA H.K. Suresh of the BJP, who visited the town, stated that it was a heinous act committed with an intention to insult Hindu

title: Every possibility of 'resounding victory' of Mahagatbhandhan in Bihar: CPI-M ahead of Assembly polls
content: Asked when seat sharing talks are expected to conclude, CPI(M) General Secretary M.A. Baby said RJD leaders will have to take the initiative

title: Singer Zubeen Garg's family to take final call on cremation site: Assam Minister
content: Sources close to the family said that Guwahati or its suburbs could be the final choice as the singer's octogenarian father will not be able to Jorhat

title: In Assam‚Äôs BTR, village bodies hunt sports talents
content: The experiment with football entails creating a conducive atmosphere and paving the way for players to graduate beyond the grassroots level

title: One killed, 24 injured as bus carrying labourers overturns in M.P.'s Shajapur
content: Labourers who had travelled to Jamnagar in Gujarat for work were returning to their native places in a private bus

title: Actor Mohanlal dedicates Dadasaheb Phalke Award to Malayalam film industry
content: Mohanlal said the¬†moment was a special and a beautiful one for him and the entire film industry.¬†‚ÄúThe award is for the entire Indian film industry,‚Äù he said

title: Three militants, arms dealer arrested in Manipur
content: The militants were involved in extorting the public, local businesses and schools, a police statement said

title: Unable to answer basic questions on Nicobar project: Jairam Ramesh slams Environment Minister Bhupender Yadav
content: Further, Congress leader Jairam Ramesh asked, ‚ÄúWhy was the National Commission on Scheduled Tribes not consulted before the Nicobar project was approved‚Äù

title: Russia-Ukraine war, volatile coal markets driving up electricity costs in India: study
content: The risk premiums are significantly higher during peak hours (6 to 11 p.m.) and rise by up to 13% on weekends, reflecting severe power supply shortages.

title: In PM Modi's Speech, A Reference To 2014 Article On India's Trade Practices
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi today said that the Goods and Services Tax reforms would usher in a countrywide "GST Bachat Utsav," benefiting poor, middle-class, farmers, traders, and entrepreneurs alike.

title: 'Company Got 5,189 H-1B Visas, Then Laid Off 16,000 Americans': US Defends Move
content: The White House issued a fact sheet, justifying US President Donald Trump's move to impose a fee of USD 100,000 on H-1B visa applications, citing concern over US workers being replaced with "lower-paid foreign labour"

title: In A Historic Move, UK, Canada And Australia Formally Recognise Palestinian State
content: Britain, Canada and Australia formally recognised a Palestinian state on Sunday, joining other nations in a move aimed at reviving momentum for a two-state solution but which has been criticised by Israel and the United States.

title: Netanyahu Confirms Progress In Syria Talks, But Says Security Deal Still Far off
content: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said on Sunday there has been progress on a security deal with Syria but an agreement was not imminent.

title: How New Visa Rules By Trump Is Shattering American Dream For Many Indians
content: Indian aerospace engineering student Sudhanva Kashyap thought he had mapped out everything it would take to get to the United States, only to have his plans upended by Washington's sudden and expensive change to its skilled worker visas.

title: "Prioritise Manufacturing, Atmosphere For Investment": PM Modi's Message For States
content: The Goods and Services Tax (GST) reforms, which kick in tomorrow, are a "double bonanza" for the poor, neo-middle class and the middle class, underlined Prime Minister Narendra Modi in an address to the nation on Sunday.

title: Next Gen GST Reforms Reflect Nagrik Devo Bhava, Says PM Modi: Top Quotes
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi addressed the nation this evening, a day ahead of the implementation of GST 2.0 reforms.

title: Full List Of Cars And Bikes That Get Cheaper Under GST 2.0
content: The much-awaited GST 2.0 will take effect from September 22, bringing sweeping changes for automobile buyers in India.

title: UK Expected To Recognise Palestinian State Despite US Opposition
content: The UK is expected to recognise a Palestinian state later Sunday despite opposition from the US, after judging that Israel has not met conditions it set over the war in Gaza.

title: BJP's "Nepo Kid" Swipe At KTR After His Gen-Z Protest Warning At NDTV Yuva
content: The BJP has launched a scathing attack on former Telangana minister and Bharat Rashtra Samithi (BRS) leader KT Rama Rao for his remark that a Nepal-like Gen-Z protest may happen in India if governments fail.

title: Nepal-Like Gen Z Protest Possible In India? What KTR Told NDTV
content: A Nepal-like Gen Z protest could happen in India if governments fail the aspirations of the people, Bharat Rashtra Samithi leader KT Rama Rao has warned.

title: What Zubeen Garg Meant To A Generation And How His Death Paralysed A City
content: Zubeen Garg's sudden death has paralysed his home state of Assam. In Guwahati, normal life froze. Shops closed, services stopped, crowds poured into the streets. The grief was not merely of losing an artist but also a cultural icon.

title: 18-Year-Old Woman Dies By Suicide Day After Lover's Murder In UP: Police
content: A young woman allegedly committed suicide by consuming poison here, a day after her lover was killed, police said on Sunday.

title: On CCTV, Thar SUV Collides With E-Rickshaw In Lucknow, 2 Killed
content: Two men in their 20s have died after a Thar SUV crashed into an e-rickshaw in Lucknow last evening. The victims have been identified as Mohit (23) and Umesh Sahu (26). Six other people have been injured in the road accident

title: France's Richest Man Slams Proposed Weath Tax As 'Assault On French Economy'
content: Bernard Arnault, the boss of luxury goods group LVMH and France's richest man, has attacked a proposed 2% tax on billionaires as an assault on France's economy and denounced the plan's architect as a far-left ideologue.

title: Ex-Diplomat Rebuts M Kharge's H1-B Attack On Centre, Kiren Rijiju Reacts
content: Union Minister Kiren Rijiju today latched on to a former Foreign Secretary's remarks on the Donald Trump administration's H1-B visa move to send a strong message to the main opposition Congress.

title: US Demands That Media Sign 10-Page Agreement To Access Military Information
content: The US Defense Department is requiring journalists to agree to use only pre-approved information about the military or lose their credentials to cover the Pentagon.

title: 'Fast And Furious': H-1B Workers Abroad Race To US Amid Chaos Over Order
content: Panic, confusion, and anger reigned as workers on H-1B visas from India and China were forced to abandon travel plans and rush back to the US after President Donald Trump imposed new visa fees, in line with his wide-ranging immigration crackdown.

title: Raleigh Home Run Watch: Will the Big Dumper hit 60?
content: the catcher has already surpassed the record for home runs by a catcher and a switch-hitter . he's now at 57 home runs and on pace for 59 with 8 games left . the american league record is 62, set by Aaron Judge in 2022 .

title: NFL picks:  An over, a cover, a parlay and multiple player props we like for Sunday

title: College football's rose-colored glasses are almost all the way cracked
content: we could bask in the comforting consistency of Clemson 's roster and believe the Tigers are back to being national title contenders . we could squint at all the portal additions Auburn made this offseason and buy into the idea that perhaps Jackson Arnold was finally ready to fulfill his potential .
